intro: Bakeriella, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe, characterized by its unique and often striking floral structures. The plants typically grow in rocky or limestone soils, adapting to harsh, arid environments. Bakeriella species are known for their small, intricate flowers that often feature a mix of colors, including purple, yellow, and white. These plants are of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to their specialized adaptations and ornamental value.
